item.description:
"Buildings affect our lives and the fate of the physical environment in which we live over the course of many years, and therefore their real test is the test of time," according to Israeli architect and author Nili Portugali. On October 29 at 6:00 pm, she expands upon her design theory at The Architects Building during an informal presentation sponsored by the BSA's Women In Design Network.

The fee is $10 ($5 for BSA members and students) and includes refreshments. RSVP by 1:00 pm on October 28 by downloading the form at www.architects.org/documents/quicklinks/GenRegform.pdf and emailing it to registration@architects.org.

Please note, you MUST also RSVP in the method outlined above, not just to this website! Thank you.
item.name: Nili Portugali lecture
